page.title: 06SELBY WAR MEMORIAL HOSPITAL
page.content: Mr. Barnard is in charge of the {nurses.}He is the{administrator}and Mrs. Lambert is in charge of the {clerical}staff etc. This hospital is erected to the memory of the Glorious Dead who fell in the Great War{1914}to {1918.}Hospital staff is:13{doctors,}40 day{nurses,}23{night nurses,}9 kitchen staff, 8 clerical staff and other staff. The{doctors}also work in their own surgeries. There are 45{patients and many day and{casualty patients. The hospital treats about 200 patients daily. There are 4 wards. The patients favourite food is stew and dumplings, and the staff's favourite food is salad. There used to be farming land here before the hospital was built. The hospital was nearly burnt down in 1960. {Marie Knapp & Maria Malinowska
